title: [ENH] refactor panel transformers that are incorrectly labelled to series transformers
body:
Good first issue - pick one transformer to work on this.

A number of transformers are in fact transformers that act independently on individual series, and have some inefficient vectorization (using "nested data frames" inside). This inefficient vectorization should be removed, and the transformers moved to the `transformations.series` module, with deprecation.

One of two things should happen:
* inefficient/loop vectorization should be replaced with efficient vectorization; `X_inner_mtype` should be changed to something more efficient, e.g., `pd-multiindex` (a `Panel` mtype)
* the vectorization should be removed, `X_inner_mtype` should be replaced with `pd.DataFrame` (a `Series` mtype). This will simplify the transformer and confer automated vectorization from the base class.

In both cases, the `"scitype:instancewise"` tag should change to `True` (since a transform is applied by instance).

The following transformers have this issue:
- [ ] `DWTTransformer`
- [ ] `SlopeTransformer`

Until #1854 is merged, work on this should be based on #1854.
